return isOn;},LoadAds:function(ids,force,waitForExternal){for(var i=0;i<ids.length;i++){this.LoadAd(ids[i],force,waitForExternal);}},LoadAd:function(id,force,waitForExternal){if(!force&&!this.__ez_fad_rdy()){setTimeout(function(){__ez.fads.LoadAd(id,force,waitForExternal);},50);return;}
if(__ez.fads.divsd.indexOf(id)==-1){this.log("loading ad",id,force,waitForExternal);__ez.fads.divsd.push(id);if(this.handleAdsense(id)){this.removeLoadingIcon(id);return;}

return false;},isPixel:function(id){return id.indexOf('-pixel')!==-1;},callExternalBidders:function(ids,force){if(!Array.isArray(ids)){ids=[ids];}
if(force!==true){var ids=ids.filter(function(id){return __ez.fads.divsdExt.indexOf(id)==-1||__ez.fads.isEligibleAdRefresh(id)==true;});}
if(ids.length==0){this.log("no ids left to call external bidders",ids);return;}

return rawSlots;},AdLoadComplete:function(library,ids){this.log("ad load complete",library,ids);if(library=='adLoadHB'){var loadIds=[];var refreshIds=[];for(var i=0;i<ids.length;i++){if(this.isGAMOnAuctionComplete(ids[i])){if(this.eligibleRefreshAds.indexOf(ids[i])!=-1){refreshIds.push(ids[i]);}else{loadIds.push(ids[i]);}

window.ezoResponsiveSizes[domID].responsiveSizes.sort(function(a,b){var largerWidth=a.minWidth>b.minWidth;var equalWidth=a.minWidth===b.minWidth;var largerHeight=a.minHeight>b.minHeight;if(largerWidth)return-1;if(equalWidth&&largerHeight)return-1;return 0;});if(window.ezoResponsiveSizes[domID].responsiveSizes){var hasSizesAtZero=false;for(var sizeIdx=0;sizeIdx<window.ezoResponsiveSizes[domID].responsiveSizes.length;sizeIdx++){var sizeDirective=window.ezoResponsiveSizes[domID].responsiveSizes[sizeIdx];if(sizeDirective.minWidth===0&&sizeDirective.minHeight===0){hasSizesAtZero=true;}

var mapping=gptSizeMapping.build();if(mapping.length<1){return false;}else{return mapping;}},adjustResponsiveDiv:function(divID){if(!window.ezoResponsiveSizes||!window.ezoResponsiveSizes[divID]){return;}

.tdb-author-descr{font-family:Source Sans Pro!important;font-size:11px!important;line-height:1.3!important}}@media(max-width:767px){.tdi_74{border:1px solid #ededed}}</style><div class="tdb-block-inner td-fix-index"><a href=https://helenadailyenglish.com/author/admin class=tdb-author-photo title="Helena Daily English"><img alt="Helena Daily English" class=tdb-author-info><a href=https://helenadailyenglish.com/author/admin class=tdb-author-name>Helena Daily English</a><a href=https://helenadailyenglish.com class=tdb-author-url>https://helenadailyenglish.com</a><div class=tdb-author-descr>One of the best ways to improve communication skills is to become familiar with the language by reading, building vocabulary, and discussing what you study in daily conversations. .tdc-elements{display:block}.tdi_76 .vc_column-inner>.wpb_wrapper .tdc-elements{width:100%}@media(min-width:768px) and (max-width:1018px){.tdi_76{width:100%!important}}</style><div data-td-block-uid=tdi_77><style>.tdi_77{margin-top:0!important}</style><style>.tdb_single_content{margin-bottom:0;*zoom:1}.tdb_single_content:before,.tdb_single_content:after{display:table;content:'';line-height:0}.tdb_single_content:after{clear:both}.tdb_single_content .tdb-block-inner blockquote p{font-family:Gelasio!important;font-style:normal!important}@media(max-width:767px){.tdb_single_content .id_ad_content-horiz-left,.tdb_single_content (max-width:1018px){.tdi_77,.tdi_77>p,.tdi_77 .tdb-block-inner>p{font-family:Source Sans Pro!important;font-size:15px!important;line-height:1.6!important}}</style><div class="tdb-block-inner td-fix-index"><div id=ftwp-container-outer class="ftwp-in-post ftwp-float-none"><div id=ftwp-container class="ftwp-wrap ftwp-hidden-state ftwp-minimize ftwp-top-right"><button type=button id=ftwp-trigger class="ftwp-shape-square ftwp-border-bold" title="click To Maximize The Table Of Contents"><span class="ftwp-trigger-icon ftwp-icon-bullet"></span></button><nav id=ftwp-contents class="ftwp-shape-square ftwp-border-thin" data-colexp=collapse><header id=ftwp-header><span id=ezoic-pub-ad-placeholder-900 data-method=placement-service></span><span id=ftwp-header-control class=ftwp-icon-bullet></span><button type=button id=ftwp-header-minimize class=ftwp-icon-collapse aria-labelledby=ftwp-header-title aria-label="Expand or collapse"></button><h3 id=ftwp-header-title>Contents</h3></header><ol id=ftwp-list class="ftwp-liststyle-none ftwp-effect-fade ftwp-list-nest ftwp-strong-first ftwp-colexp ftwp-colexp-icon" style=display:none><li class="ftwp-item ftwp-has-sub ftwp-collapse"><button type=button aria-label="Expand or collapse" class=ftwp-icon-collapse></button><a class=ftwp-anchor href=#ftoc-heading-1><span class=ftwp-text>Basic English Conversation: 100 Daily Topics | Topic: 41 -50</span></a><ol class=ftwp-sub><li class=ftwp-item><a class=ftwp-anchor href=#ftoc-heading-2><span class=ftwp-text>Lesson 41: THE FOOD TASTES GREAT</span></a><li class=ftwp-item><a class=ftwp-anchor href=#ftoc-heading-3><span class=ftwp-text>Lesson 42: HELPING A FRIEND MOVE</span></a><li class=ftwp-item><a class=ftwp-anchor PICTURES</span></a><li class=ftwp-item><a class=ftwp-anchor href=#ftoc-heading-6><span class=ftwp-text>Lesson 45: ORDERING FLOWERS</span></a><li class=ftwp-item><a class=ftwp-anchor WEATHER</span></a><li class=ftwp-item><a class=ftwp-anchor href=#ftoc-heading-9><span class=ftwp-text>Lesson 48: MAKING PLANS</span></a><li class=ftwp-item><a class=ftwp-anchor STUDENT</span></a></ol></ol></nav></div></div><div id=ftwp-postcontent><h2 id=ftoc-heading-1 class=ftwp-heading>Basic English Conversation: 100 Daily Topics | Topic: 41 -50</h2><h3 id=ftoc-heading-2 class=ftwp-heading><span style=background-color:#ff0><strong>Lesson 41: THE FOOD TASTES GREAT</strong></span></h3><p><strong><script type=text/ez-screx>AudioPlayer.setup("https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/plugins/simple-audio-player/player/player.swf",{width:290});</script></strong><p id=audioplayer_1974><strong><audio controls><source src=https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/100%20conversations/41_The%20food%20tastes%20great.MP3 type=audio/mpeg></audio></strong><p><script type=text/ez-screx>AudioPlayer.embed("audioplayer_1974",{soundFile:"https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/100%20conversations/41_The%20food%20tastes%20great.MP3",titles:"Helena Daily English",autostart:"no",loop:"no",animation:"yes",remaining:"yes",noinfo:"no",initialvolume:"70",buffer:"5",encode:"no",checkpolicy:"no",rtl:"no",width:"100%",transparentpagebg:"no",bg:"E5E5E5",leftbg:"CCCCCC",lefticon:"333333",voltrack:"F2F2F2",volslider:"666666",rightbg:"B4B4B4",rightbghover:"999999",righticon:"333333",righticonhover:"FFFFFF",loader:"009900",track:"FFFFFF",tracker:"DDDDDD",border:"CCCCCC",skip:"666666",text:"333333"});</script><p><ul><li><strong>How do you like the food?</strong><li>It tastes really great. Did you cook it?<li><strong>Yes. I made it this afternoon. Would you like some more?</strong><li>OK, just a little though. I’m really full.<li><strong>Oh. Would you like some soup instead?</strong><li>What kind is it?<li><strong>Tomato and rice. Have you had that before?</strong><li>No. This is my first time. How does it taste?<li><strong>It’s good, try it. What do you think?</strong><li>Wow. It is good. Did you make that also?<li><strong>Yes.</strong><li>You’re a really good cook.<li><strong>Thanks, next time I’ll make chicken soup for us.</strong><li>That sounds good. Did you study cooking in school?<li><strong>No, I learned by myself. I have a good cookbook that I read when I have time. </strong></ul><h3 id=ftoc-heading-3 class=ftwp-heading><span style=background-color:#ff0><strong>Lesson 42: HELPING A FRIEND MOVE</strong></span></h3><span class="ezoic-autoinsert-video ezoic-under_first_paragraph"></span><p><strong><script type=text/ez-screx>AudioPlayer.setup("https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/plugins/simple-audio-player/player/player.swf",{width:290});</script></strong><p id=audioplayer_9945><strong><audio controls><source src=https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/100%20conversations/42_Helping%20a%20friend%20move.MP3 type=audio/mpeg></audio></strong><p><script type=text/ez-screx>AudioPlayer.embed("audioplayer_9945",{soundFile:"https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/100%20conversations/42_Helping%20a%20friend%20move.MP3",titles:"Helena Daily English",autostart:"no",loop:"no",animation:"yes",remaining:"yes",noinfo:"no",initialvolume:"70",buffer:"5",encode:"no",checkpolicy:"no",rtl:"no",width:"100%",transparentpagebg:"no",bg:"E5E5E5",leftbg:"CCCCCC",lefticon:"333333",voltrack:"F2F2F2",volslider:"666666",rightbg:"B4B4B4",rightbghover:"999999",righticon:"333333",righticonhover:"FFFFFF",loader:"009900",track:"FFFFFF",tracker:"DDDDDD",border:"CCCCCC",skip:"666666",text:"333333"});</script><p><ul><li><strong>Kelly, will you help me take these things to the car?</strong><li>OK, which car do you want me to put them in?<li><strong>Bring them to my wife’s car.</strong><li>Which one is hers?<li><strong>The blue SUV in front of the Honda.</strong><li>What should I take first?<li><strong>That chair over there, but please be careful with it. It was a gift from my mother-in-law.</strong><li>Don’t worry, I won’t drop it. Wow, it’s really heavy. I don’t think I can move it by myself.<li><strong>Let me help you with that. I don’t want you to hurt your back.</strong><li>Where are you taking all this stuff?<li><strong>Didn’t I tell you? We’re moving to Florida?</strong><li>You’re moving now? I knew you were moving, but I thought you said you were moving next month.<li><strong>Yes, that’s true, but my wife found a new apartment on the Internet the other day</strong> <strong>and she wants to move right away.</strong></ul><p><strong> </strong><h3 id=ftoc-heading-4 class=ftwp-heading><span style=background-color:#ff0><strong>Lesson 43: VISITING FAMILY</strong></span></h3><span class="ezoic-autoinsert-video ezoic-under_second_paragraph"></span><p><strong><script type=text/ez-screx>AudioPlayer.setup("https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/plugins/simple-audio-player/player/player.swf",{width:290});</script></strong><p id=audioplayer_4396><strong><audio controls><source src=https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/100%20conversations/43_Visiting%20family.MP3 type=audio/mpeg></audio></strong><p><script type=text/ez-screx>AudioPlayer.embed("audioplayer_4396",{soundFile:"https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/100%20conversations/43_Visiting%20family.MP3",titles:"Helena Daily English",autostart:"no",loop:"no",animation:"yes",remaining:"yes",noinfo:"no",initialvolume:"70",buffer:"5",encode:"no",checkpolicy:"no",rtl:"no",width:"100%",transparentpagebg:"no",bg:"E5E5E5",leftbg:"CCCCCC",lefticon:"333333",voltrack:"F2F2F2",volslider:"666666",rightbg:"B4B4B4",rightbghover:"999999",righticon:"333333",righticonhover:"FFFFFF",loader:"009900",track:"FFFFFF",tracker:"DDDDDD",border:"CCCCCC",skip:"666666",text:"333333"});</script><p><ul><li><strong>Judy, your husband has a really nice car.</strong><li>Thanks. It’s a lot better than mine, and it’s new.<li><strong>Where are you going?</strong><li>We’re going to visit my sister in the city.<li><strong>I didn’t know your sister lives in the city, when did she move there?</strong><li>About a year ago. She lives in an apartment on 3rd street, across from the public library.<li><strong>I see. It’s almost 5:00 PM now, don’t you think there will be a lot of traffic?</strong><li>Oh, we’re not driving. We’re going to take the subway. The subway only takes about 20 minutes.<li><strong>Yes, but it can be very crowded around this time. I always feel uncomfortable</strong> <strong>taking the subway.</strong><li>I take the subway to work every day, so I’m used to it now.<li><strong>Doesn’t your mother live in the city?</strong><li>Yes, she’s lived there for about ten years.<li><strong>I remember when she moved there. Apartments were a lot cheaper then.</strong><li>I know what you mean. It’s hard to find anything that’s reasonable now.<li><strong>Have a good time. Next time you’re free, give me a call and we’ll go play poker.</strong><li>See you later.</ul><h3 id=ftoc-heading-5 class=ftwp-heading><span style=background-color:#ff0><strong>Lesson 44: LOOKING AT VACATION PICTURES</strong></span></h3><span class="ezoic-autoinsert-video ezoic-mid_content"></span><p><strong><script type=text/ez-screx>AudioPlayer.setup("https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/plugins/simple-audio-player/player/player.swf",{width:290});</script></strong><p id=audioplayer_7984><strong><audio controls><source src=https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/100%20conversations/44_Looking%20at%20vacation%20pictures.MP3 type=audio/mpeg></audio></strong><p><script type=text/ez-screx>AudioPlayer.embed("audioplayer_7984",{soundFile:"https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/100%20conversations/44_Looking%20at%20vacation%20pictures.MP3",titles:"Helena Daily English",autostart:"no",loop:"no",animation:"yes",remaining:"yes",noinfo:"no",initialvolume:"70",buffer:"5",encode:"no",checkpolicy:"no",rtl:"no",width:"100%",transparentpagebg:"no",bg:"E5E5E5",leftbg:"CCCCCC",lefticon:"333333",voltrack:"F2F2F2",volslider:"666666",rightbg:"B4B4B4",rightbghover:"999999",righticon:"333333",righticonhover:"FFFFFF",loader:"009900",track:"FFFFFF",tracker:"DDDDDD",border:"CCCCCC",skip:"666666",text:"333333"});</script><p><ul><li><strong>Jim, I heard you took a trip to San Diego. Is that right?</strong><span class="ezoic-autoinsert-ad ezoic-longest_content"></span><span style=clear:both;display:block id=ez-clearholder-leader-1></span><span class="ezoic-ad ezoic-at-0 leader-1 leader-1560 adtester-container adtester-container-560" data-ez-name=helenadailyenglish_com-leader-1><span id=div-gpt-ad-helenadailyenglish_com-leader-1-0 ezaw=250 ezah=250 style=position:relative;z-index:0;display:inline-block;padding:0;position:sticky!important;top:0!important;min-height:250px;min-width:250px class="ezoic-ad ezads-sticky-intradiv ezoic-adl"><script data-ezscrex=false data-cfasync=false style=display:none>if(typeof ez_ad_units=='undefined'){ez_ad_units=[];}ez_ad_units.push([[250,250],'helenadailyenglish_com-leader-1','ezslot_12',560,'0','0','helenadailyenglish_com-leader-1-0']);if(typeof __ez_fad_position=='function'){__ez_fad_position('div-gpt-ad-helenadailyenglish_com-leader-1-0');}</script></span></span><span data-nosnippet style="display:block;height:14px;margin:2px auto;position:relative" class=reportline data-ez-ph-owner-id=37><span style=text-align:center;font-size:12px!important;font-family:arial!important;float:right;line-height:normal class=ezoicwhat><img src=https://go.ezodn.com/utilcave_com/ezoicbwa.png alt=Ezoic loading=lazy style=height:14px!important;padding:2px!important;border:0!important;cursor:pointer!important;width:14px!important;margin:0!important;box-sizing:content-box!important title=ezoic name="?pageview_id=6cc5786f-b255-4111-59b0-39383dfc67c8&amp;ad_position_id=37&amp;impression_group_id=helenadailyenglish_com-leader-1/2024-01-03/9168609204671877&amp;ad_size=250x250&amp;domain_id=359653&amp;url=https://helenadailyenglish.com/basic-english-conversation-100-daily-topics-topic-41-50.html"></span></span><li>Yeah, I just got back this morning.<li><strong>That sounds really nice. What did you do there?</strong><li>Well, we were only there for three days, so we didn’t do too much. We went shopping and went out to dinner a few times. At night we walked around the city with some friends.<li><strong>Did you take any pictures?</strong><li>Yes, I have them with me. Do you want to look at them?<li><strong>Sure, I love looking at photos.</strong><li>This one is of my wife and me on the beach, and this one is our daughter Emily standing next to my wife.<li><strong>Your daughter looks like her mother.</strong><li>I know, they look very similar.<li><strong>Where was this picture taken?</strong><li>That was taken at the train station before we left.<li><strong>Did you have time to go to the zoo?</strong><li>No, not this time. We went there last time.<li><strong>It looks like you all had a nice time.</strong><li>Yeah, it was a lot of fun.</ul><h3 id=ftoc-heading-6 class=ftwp-heading><span style=background-color:#ff0><strong>Lesson 45: ORDERING FLOWERS</strong></span></h3><span class="ezoic-autoinsert-video ezoic-long_content"></span><p><strong><script type=text/ez-screx>AudioPlayer.setup("https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/plugins/simple-audio-player/player/player.swf",{width:290});</script></strong><p id=audioplayer_8867><strong><audio controls><source src=https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/100%20conversations/45_Ordering%20flowers.MP3 type=audio/mpeg></audio></strong><p><script type=text/ez-screx>AudioPlayer.embed("audioplayer_8867",{soundFile:"https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/100%20conversations/45_Ordering%20flowers.MP3",titles:"Helena Daily English",autostart:"no",loop:"no",animation:"yes",remaining:"yes",noinfo:"no",initialvolume:"70",buffer:"5",encode:"no",checkpolicy:"no",rtl:"no",width:"100%",transparentpagebg:"no",bg:"E5E5E5",leftbg:"CCCCCC",lefticon:"333333",voltrack:"F2F2F2",volslider:"666666",rightbg:"B4B4B4",rightbghover:"999999",righticon:"333333",righticonhover:"FFFFFF",loader:"009900",track:"FFFFFF",tracker:"DDDDDD",border:"CCCCCC",skip:"666666",text:"333333"});</script><p><ul><li><strong>Good afternoon, how may I help you?</strong><li>Hi, I’d like to order some flowers.<li><strong>Who are they for?</strong><li>They’re for my Wife. Her name is Samantha.<li><strong>What kind of flowers would you like?</strong><li>I don’t know. I don’t know too much about flowers. Can you recommend something?<li><strong style=color:initial>What’s the reason you are sending her flowers?</strong><span class="ezoic-autoinsert-ad ezoic-incontent_5"></span><span style=clear:both;display:block id=ez-clearholder-large-mobile-banner-2></span><span class="ezoic-ad ezoic-at-0 large-mobile-banner-2 large-mobile-banner-2700 adtester-container adtester-container-700" data-ez-name=helenadailyenglish_com-large-mobile-banner-2><span id=div-gpt-ad-helenadailyenglish_com-large-mobile-banner-2-0 ezaw=336 ezah=280 style=position:relative;z-index:0;display:inline-block;padding:0;position:sticky!important;top:0!important;min-height:280px;min-width:336px class="ezoic-ad ezads-sticky-intradiv ezoic-adl"><script data-ezscrex=false data-cfasync=false style=display:none>if(typeof ez_ad_units=='undefined'){ez_ad_units=[];}ez_ad_units.push([[336,280],'helenadailyenglish_com-large-mobile-banner-2','ezslot_7',700,'0','0','helenadailyenglish_com-large-mobile-banner-2-0']);if(typeof __ez_fad_position=='function'){__ez_fad_position('div-gpt-ad-helenadailyenglish_com-large-mobile-banner-2-0');}</script></span></span><span data-nosnippet style="display:block;height:14px;margin:2px auto;position:relative" class=reportline data-ez-ph-owner-id=700><span style=text-align:center;font-size:12px!important;font-family:arial!important;float:right;line-height:normal class=ezoicwhat><img src=https://go.ezodn.com/utilcave_com/ezoicbwa.png alt=Ezoic loading=lazy style=height:14px!important;padding:2px!important;border:0!important;cursor:pointer!important;width:14px!important;margin:0!important;box-sizing:content-box!important title=ezoic name="?pageview_id=6cc5786f-b255-4111-59b0-39383dfc67c8&amp;ad_position_id=700&amp;impression_group_id=helenadailyenglish_com-large-mobile-banner-2/2024-01-03/5259095100667976&amp;ad_size=336x280&amp;domain_id=359653&amp;url=https://helenadailyenglish.com/basic-english-conversation-100-daily-topics-topic-41-50.html"></span></span><li>Today’s her birthday and she told me she wants me to buy her flowers.<li><strong>Do you know what kind of flowers she likes?</strong><li>I’m not sure. I know I should know that, but I can’t remember right now.<li><strong>Well, they’re for your wife, so I think you should give her roses.</strong><li>Roses will be fine.<li><strong>What color?</strong><li>I think red would be nice.<li><strong>Do you want to pick them up or should we deliver them?</strong><li>Can you deliver them please?<li><strong>What’s the address?</strong><li>241 Main street.<li><strong>Alright, they’ll be there within 2 hours.</strong><strong> </strong></ul><h3 id=ftoc-heading-7 class=ftwp-heading><span style=background-color:#ff0><strong>Lesson 46: LEAVING A MESSAGE</strong></span></h3><span class="ezoic-autoinsert-video ezoic-longer_content"></span><p><strong><script type=text/ez-screx>AudioPlayer.setup("https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/plugins/simple-audio-player/player/player.swf",{width:290});</script></strong><p id=audioplayer_8528><strong><audio controls><source src=https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/100%20conversations/46_Leaving%20a%20message.MP3 type=audio/mpeg></audio></strong><p><script type=text/ez-screx>AudioPlayer.embed("audioplayer_8528",{soundFile:"https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/100%20conversations/46_Leaving%20a%20message.MP3",titles:"Helena Daily English",autostart:"no",loop:"no",animation:"yes",remaining:"yes",noinfo:"no",initialvolume:"70",buffer:"5",encode:"no",checkpolicy:"no",rtl:"no",width:"100%",transparentpagebg:"no",bg:"E5E5E5",leftbg:"CCCCCC",lefticon:"333333",voltrack:"F2F2F2",volslider:"666666",rightbg:"B4B4B4",rightbghover:"999999",righticon:"333333",righticonhover:"FFFFFF",loader:"009900",track:"FFFFFF",tracker:"DDDDDD",border:"CCCCCC",skip:"666666",text:"333333"});</script><p><ul><li><strong>Hello?</strong><li>Hi, is Heather there, please?<li><strong>Sorry, I think you have the wrong number.</strong><li>Is this 617-228-2289?<li><strong>Yes. Who are you looking for again?</strong><li>Heather Johnson.<li><strong>Oh, I thought you said Laura. Sorry about that. This is the right number, but</strong> <strong>Heather’s not here right now.</strong><li>Do you know where she went?<li><strong>She went to the store to buy some groceries. Would you like to leave a message?</strong><li>Yes, would you please tell her Eric Martin called?<li><strong>Hi Eric, this is her roommate Kathy. I met you a couple of months ago at the</strong> <strong>Christmas party.</strong><li>Oh, yes. How are you?<li><strong>Good. Heather will be back in about 20 minutes. I’ll tell her you called.</strong><span class="ezoic-autoinsert-ad ezoic-incontent_6"></span><span style=clear:both;display:block id=ez-clearholder-leader-2></span><span class="ezoic-ad ezoic-at-0 leader-2 leader-2701 adtester-container adtester-container-701" data-ez-name=helenadailyenglish_com-leader-2><span id=div-gpt-ad-helenadailyenglish_com-leader-2-0 ezaw=336 ezah=280 style=position:relative;z-index:0;display:inline-block;padding:0;position:sticky!important;top:0!important;min-height:280px;min-width:336px class="ezoic-ad ezads-sticky-intradiv ezoic-adl"><script data-ezscrex=false data-cfasync=false style=display:none>if(typeof ez_ad_units=='undefined'){ez_ad_units=[];}ez_ad_units.push([[336,280],'helenadailyenglish_com-leader-2','ezslot_8',701,'0','0','helenadailyenglish_com-leader-2-0']);if(typeof __ez_fad_position=='function'){__ez_fad_position('div-gpt-ad-helenadailyenglish_com-leader-2-0');}</script></span></span><span data-nosnippet style="display:block;height:14px;margin:2px auto;position:relative" class=reportline data-ez-ph-owner-id=701><span style=text-align:center;font-size:12px!important;font-family:arial!important;float:right;line-height:normal class=ezoicwhat><img src=https://go.ezodn.com/utilcave_com/ezoicbwa.png alt=Ezoic loading=lazy style=height:14px!important;padding:2px!important;border:0!important;cursor:pointer!important;width:14px!important;margin:0!important;box-sizing:content-box!important title=ezoic name="?pageview_id=6cc5786f-b255-4111-59b0-39383dfc67c8&amp;ad_position_id=701&amp;impression_group_id=helenadailyenglish_com-leader-2/2024-01-03/8778240258698855&amp;ad_size=336x280&amp;domain_id=359653&amp;url=https://helenadailyenglish.com/basic-english-conversation-100-daily-topics-topic-41-50.html"></span></span><li>Thanks.<li><strong>Bye bye.</strong><strong> </strong></ul><p><strong> </strong><h3 id=ftoc-heading-8 class=ftwp-heading><span style=background-color:#ff0><strong>Lesson 47: TALKING ABOUT THE WEATHER</strong></span></h3><span class="ezoic-autoinsert-video ezoic-longest_content"></span><p><strong><script type=text/ez-screx>AudioPlayer.setup("https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/plugins/simple-audio-player/player/player.swf",{width:290});</script></strong><p id=audioplayer_3952><strong><audio controls><source src=https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/100%20conversations/47_Talking%20about%20the%20weather.MP3 type=audio/mpeg></audio></strong><p><script type=text/ez-screx>AudioPlayer.embed("audioplayer_3952",{soundFile:"https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/100%20conversations/47_Talking%20about%20the%20weather.MP3",titles:"Helena Daily English",autostart:"no",loop:"no",animation:"yes",remaining:"yes",noinfo:"no",initialvolume:"70",buffer:"5",encode:"no",checkpolicy:"no",rtl:"no",width:"100%",transparentpagebg:"no",bg:"E5E5E5",leftbg:"CCCCCC",lefticon:"333333",voltrack:"F2F2F2",volslider:"666666",rightbg:"B4B4B4",rightbghover:"999999",righticon:"333333",righticonhover:"FFFFFF",loader:"009900",track:"FFFFFF",tracker:"DDDDDD",border:"CCCCCC",skip:"666666",text:"333333"});</script><p><ul><li><strong>Hello?</strong><li>Hi Tina, It’s Joe.<li><strong>Hi Joe.</strong><li>How’s the weather there today?<li><strong>It’s really cold. It snowed all day and the schools closed early.</strong><li>What’s the temperature?<li><strong>It’s 30 degrees now. It was even colder this morning.</strong><li>Have you heard what the weather is going to be like tomorrow?<li><strong>I was watching the news a little earlier. They said it’s probably going to snow</strong> <strong>tomorrow.</strong><li>I really don’t like the winter. I wish it were summer.<li><strong>Me too. How’s the weather where you are?</strong><li>It’s not too bad, but it’s pretty cold here too. It was about 45 today and it rained this afternoon. I heard it’s going to be a little warmer tomorrow.</ul><p><strong> </strong><h3 id=ftoc-heading-9 class=ftwp-heading><span style=background-color:#ff0><strong>Lesson 48: MAKING PLANS</strong></span></h3><p><strong><script type=text/ez-screx>AudioPlayer.setup("https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/plugins/simple-audio-player/player/player.swf",{width:290});</script></strong><p id=audioplayer_7537><strong><audio controls><source src=https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/100%20conversations/48_Making%20plans.MP3 type=audio/mpeg></audio></strong><p><script type=text/ez-screx>AudioPlayer.embed("audioplayer_7537",{soundFile:"https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/100%20conversations/48_Making%20plans.MP3",titles:"Helena Daily English",autostart:"no",loop:"no",animation:"yes",remaining:"yes",noinfo:"no",initialvolume:"70",buffer:"5",encode:"no",checkpolicy:"no",rtl:"no",width:"100%",transparentpagebg:"no",bg:"E5E5E5",leftbg:"CCCCCC",lefticon:"333333",voltrack:"F2F2F2",volslider:"666666",rightbg:"B4B4B4",rightbghover:"999999",righticon:"333333",righticonhover:"FFFFFF",loader:"009900",track:"FFFFFF",tracker:"DDDDDD",border:"CCCCCC",skip:"666666",text:"333333"});</script><p><ul><li><strong>It’s almost Christmas. What are you doing this weekend?</strong><li>Nothing special, just working. Why do you ask?<li><strong>Well, I still haven’t finished my Christmas shopping. Do you want to go shopping</strong> <strong>with me this weekend?</strong><span class="ezoic-autoinsert-ad ezoic-incontent_7"></span><span style=clear:both;display:block id=ez-clearholder-large-mobile-banner-1></span><span class="ezoic-ad ezoic-at-0 large-mobile-banner-1 large-mobile-banner-1702 adtester-container adtester-container-702" data-ez-name=helenadailyenglish_com-large-mobile-banner-1><span id=div-gpt-ad-helenadailyenglish_com-large-mobile-banner-1-0 ezaw=336 ezah=280 style=position:relative;z-index:0;display:inline-block;padding:0;position:sticky!important;top:0!important;min-height:280px;min-width:336px class="ezoic-ad ezads-sticky-intradiv ezoic-adl"><script data-ezscrex=false data-cfasync=false style=display:none>if(typeof ez_ad_units=='undefined'){ez_ad_units=[];}ez_ad_units.push([[336,280],'helenadailyenglish_com-large-mobile-banner-1','ezslot_6',702,'0','0','helenadailyenglish_com-large-mobile-banner-1-0']);if(typeof __ez_fad_position=='function'){__ez_fad_position('div-gpt-ad-helenadailyenglish_com-large-mobile-banner-1-0');}</script></span></span><span data-nosnippet style="display:block;height:14px;margin:2px auto;position:relative" class=reportline data-ez-ph-owner-id=702><span style=text-align:center;font-size:12px!important;font-family:arial!important;float:right;line-height:normal class=ezoicwhat><img src=https://go.ezodn.com/utilcave_com/ezoicbwa.png alt=Ezoic loading=lazy style=height:14px!important;padding:2px!important;border:0!important;cursor:pointer!important;width:14px!important;margin:0!important;box-sizing:content-box!important title=ezoic name="?pageview_id=6cc5786f-b255-4111-59b0-39383dfc67c8&amp;ad_position_id=702&amp;impression_group_id=helenadailyenglish_com-large-mobile-banner-1/2024-01-03/7899256370726742&amp;ad_size=336x280&amp;domain_id=359653&amp;url=https://helenadailyenglish.com/basic-english-conversation-100-daily-topics-topic-41-50.html"></span></span><li>I’d like to, but I’m not sure if I can. Work has been really busy lately. Why don’t we go on Friday instead?<li><strong>Friday’s not good. I think the stores will be very crowded and I have to work.</strong><li>OK, then let’s try to go this weekend. I should know if I can go by Friday. Is it OK if I call you then?<li><strong>Yeah, that’s fine.</strong><li>What’s your number?<li><strong>233-331-8828. Let me give you my email address too. It’s sara@gmail.com</strong><li>OK, I’ll talk to you soon.<li><strong>OK.</strong></ul><h3 id=ftoc-heading-10 class=ftwp-heading><span style=background-color:#ff0><strong>Lesson 49: MEETING A FRIEND</strong></span></h3><p><strong><script type=text/ez-screx>AudioPlayer.setup("https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/plugins/simple-audio-player/player/player.swf",{width:290});</script></strong><p id=audioplayer_2516><strong><audio controls><source src=https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/100%20conversations/49_Meeting%20a%20friend.MP3 type=audio/mpeg></audio></strong><p><script type=text/ez-screx>AudioPlayer.embed("audioplayer_2516",{soundFile:"https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/100%20conversations/49_Meeting%20a%20friend.MP3",titles:"Helena Daily English",autostart:"no",loop:"no",animation:"yes",remaining:"yes",noinfo:"no",initialvolume:"70",buffer:"5",encode:"no",checkpolicy:"no",rtl:"no",width:"100%",transparentpagebg:"no",bg:"E5E5E5",leftbg:"CCCCCC",lefticon:"333333",voltrack:"F2F2F2",volslider:"666666",rightbg:"B4B4B4",rightbghover:"999999",righticon:"333333",righticonhover:"FFFFFF",loader:"009900",track:"FFFFFF",tracker:"DDDDDD",border:"CCCCCC",skip:"666666",text:"333333"});</script><p><ul><li><strong>Hello?</strong><li>Hi Vicky.<li><strong>Are you there yet?</strong><li>Yes.<li><strong>I just got off the subway. I’m almost there. Sorry, I’m late.</strong><li>That’s no problem. I just wanted to tell you I’m inside.<li><strong>Where are you?</strong><li>On the second floor.<li><strong>Should I come to the second floor or do you want to come to the first floor?</strong><li>Come upstairs.<li><strong>What?</strong><li>Oh, Can you hear me OK? I said, come to the second floor.<li><strong>Oh, OK. What are you doing there?</strong><li>Just looking at some books on how to learn English.<li><strong>Do you want to get something to eat later?</strong><li>No, I’m still full from dinner.<li><strong>What do you want to do?</strong><span class="ezoic-autoinsert-ad ezoic-incontent_8"></span><span style=clear:both;display:block id=ez-clearholder-leader-3></span><span class="ezoic-ad ezoic-at-0 leader-3 leader-3703 adtester-container adtester-container-703" data-ez-name=helenadailyenglish_com-leader-3><span id=div-gpt-ad-helenadailyenglish_com-leader-3-0 ezaw=300 ezah=250 style=position:relative;z-index:0;display:inline-block;padding:0;position:sticky!important;top:0!important;min-height:250px;min-width:300px class="ezoic-ad ezads-sticky-intradiv ezoic-adl"><script data-ezscrex=false data-cfasync=false style=display:none>if(typeof ez_ad_units=='undefined'){ez_ad_units=[];}ez_ad_units.push([[300,250],'helenadailyenglish_com-leader-3','ezslot_13',703,'0','0','helenadailyenglish_com-leader-3-0']);if(typeof __ez_fad_position=='function'){__ez_fad_position('div-gpt-ad-helenadailyenglish_com-leader-3-0');}</script></span></span><span data-nosnippet style="display:block;height:14px;margin:2px auto;position:relative" class=reportline data-ez-ph-owner-id=703><span style=text-align:center;font-size:12px!important;font-family:arial!important;float:right;line-height:normal class=ezoicwhat><img src=https://go.ezodn.com/utilcave_com/ezoicbwa.png alt=Ezoic loading=lazy style=height:14px!important;padding:2px!important;border:0!important;cursor:pointer!important;width:14px!important;margin:0!important;box-sizing:content-box!important title=ezoic name="?pageview_id=6cc5786f-b255-4111-59b0-39383dfc67c8&amp;ad_position_id=703&amp;impression_group_id=helenadailyenglish_com-leader-3/2024-01-03/9165522190717395&amp;ad_size=300x250&amp;domain_id=359653&amp;url=https://helenadailyenglish.com/basic-english-conversation-100-daily-topics-topic-41-50.html"></span></span><li>I don’t know for sure. When you get here we’ll talk about it.<li><strong>OK, see you soon.</strong><li>Bye.</ul><h3 id=ftoc-heading-11 class=ftwp-heading><span style=background-color:#ff0><strong>Lesson 50: I’M A STUDENT</strong></span></h3><p><strong><script type=text/ez-screx>AudioPlayer.setup("https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/plugins/simple-audio-player/player/player.swf",{width:290});</script></strong><p id=audioplayer_3751><strong><audio controls><source src="https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/100%20conversations/50_I'm%20a%20student.MP3" type=audio/mpeg></audio></strong><p><script type=text/ez-screx>AudioPlayer.embed("audioplayer_3751",{soundFile:"https://helenadailyenglish.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/100%20conversations/50_I'm%20a%20student.MP3",titles:"Helena Daily English",autostart:"no",loop:"no",animation:"yes",remaining:"yes",noinfo:"no",initialvolume:"70",buffer:"5",encode:"no",checkpolicy:"no",rtl:"no",width:"100%",transparentpagebg:"no",bg:"E5E5E5",leftbg:"CCCCCC",lefticon:"333333",voltrack:"F2F2F2",volslider:"666666",rightbg:"B4B4B4",rightbghover:"999999",righticon:"333333",righticonhover:"FFFFFF",loader:"009900",track:"FFFFFF",tracker:"DDDDDD",border:"CCCCCC",skip:"666666",text:"333333"});</script><p><ul><li><strong>Craig, what do you do for work?</strong><li>I’m still a student.<li><strong>What school do you go to?</strong><li>Boston University.<li><strong>That’s a good school. What do you study?</strong><li>I’m studying English, math, and history. My major is English.<li><strong>How long have you been studying English?</strong><li>More than six years.<li><strong>That’s a long time.</strong><li>Yeah, I started to learn English when I was in high school.<li><strong>No wonder your English is so good.</strong><li>Actually, it’s not that good. I can read but I can’t speak very well. I haven’t had a lot of chances to practice.<li><strong>I see. Talking with other people is very important.</strong><li>Yes, but I still don’t have many friends here yet.<li><strong>I’m having a party tonight at my apartment. You should come.</strong><li>Oh thanks for inviting me. I’d love to come.<strong> </strong></ul><p><span style=background-color:#ff0><strong>More lesson</strong>: <a style=background-color:#ff0 href=https://helenadailyenglish.com/basic-english-conversation-100-daily-topics><span style=color:revert;font-size:revert;font-weight:revert;background-color:#ff0>Basic English Conversation: 100 Daily Topics</span></a></span><p></div></div></div><div class="wpb_wrapper td_block_wrap vc_raw_html tdi_79"><div class=td-fix-index><div class=mailmunch-forms-widget-684807></div></div></div><div
